summary.title: Service Summary
summary.description: A brief description of a specific technical or access service offered, such as the use of X to investigate Y

description.title: Service Description
description.description: A longer description/documentation of a specific technical or access service offered under E-RIHS

operating_languages.title: Operating Languages
operating_languages.description: What languages can the team operate in or what language is a tool presented in

summary.title: Summary of the support
summary.description: General description of the support or any required caption/citation

techniques.title: Service Techniques
techniques.description: A list of the individual relevant heritage science examination and analytical techniques carried out within this Service - selected from a publicly defined controlled list. This free text option will need to be replaced with a controlled list.

application_required.title: Application required
application_required.description: Is an application for access required

provider_id.title: Provider ID
provider_id.description: An actor (organisation or person) offering this service, as defined in the system.

provider_role.title: Provider Role
provider_role.description: This value should be replaced with a controlled list

research_disciplines.title: Research Disciplines
research_disciplines.description: Which domains or disciplines has a given service worked within, has experience within.

categories.title: Service Categories
categories.description: An externally defined service top level categories defining what types of work the included techniques are used to carry out - selected from a publicly defined controlled list.

functions.title: Service Functions
functions.description: An externally defined service practical level activity, what has a service been used for, what is it intended for.

methods.title: Method statements for the activities in the service
methods.description: Service related method statements should be defined in the system and represent the procedures for using individual pieces of equipment or software systems used within the service - detail of setup, methodology, procedures, etc. should all be described within this document and is also directly attached to relevant the Tool (equipment or software) records.

resources.title: Collections, Objects, Samples and Archives
resources.description: Research resources made accessible by the service should be defined in the system and represent the heritage collections, objects, samples, archives, other research resources directly provided by the service.

limitations.title: Service Limitations
limitations.description: Description of any limitations in the access provision by the service.

team_member_id.title: Person ID
team_member_id.description: An actor as defined in the system

roles.title: Person Roles
roles.description: This value should be replaced with a controlled list

start_date.title: Joined service date
start_date.description: A date to indicate when a given person joined the team working on a given service.

end_date.title: Left service date
end_date.description: A date to indicate when a given person left the team working on a given service.

url.title: Link URL
url.description: A related resolvable URL not covered by the other fields

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: The formatted details for the given reference.

example_outputs.title: Example output datasets
example_outputs.description: Services that generate data can provide PIDs/URLs for example datasets to demonstrate what types of data and information will be created.

example_inputs.title: Example input datasets
example_inputs.description: Services that process data can provide PIDs/URLs for example datasets to demonstrate what data and formats are required for the Service to run.

version.title: Service Version
version.description: Service develop over time with changes of equipment, software, personnel, etc. Version numbers should be changed to indicate these changes - please note very large scale changes may warrant the creation of a new Service record to clarify differences in the data or results created.

version_date.title: Service Version Date
version_date.description: The version date is the date from which this particular version of this Service was offered in a formal capacity by the defined Access provider.

creation_date.title: Service Creation Date
creation_date.description: The creation date is the date from which this particular Service was offered in a formal capacity by the defined Access provider.

dmp.title: Service Data Management Plan
dmp.description: An open description of the data management procedures followed with the defined service, including licence issues, preferred data repositories, publication embargoes, common file formats, software and systems used, etc.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: The formatted details for the given reference.

dmp_variation.title: Variation from E-RIHS DMP
dmp_variation.description: Description of any required data management differences that may be required for the service, in relation to national, funding or institutional limitations; some differences could be easily manageable but other might require updates to the E-RIHS DMP.

dataflow_description.title: Dataflow description
dataflow_description.description: A reference to a diagram or written description of the dataflow. More complex services, multiple pieces of equipment or data processing steps, might benefit for a summary description of the key stages, including details of any required background information, direct input from users and any processing steps.

citation.title: Citation
citation.description: The formatted details for the given reference.

output_description.title: Service Output Description
output_description.description: A description of all of the raw and processes outputs created by a given services including details of how they relate to or rely on each other.

input_description.title: Service Input Description
input_description.description: A description of the required formats or files required for any service which processes existing data.

further_comments.title: Other Comments
further_comments.description: Free text opportunity to advocate for what is novel or special about this particular access

keywords.title: Service keywords
keywords.description: Additional terms and concepts not covered by the other fields

access_unit.title: Service Access Period Unit
access_unit.description: For previously defined services this has commonly been defined in days or occasionally hours - but with the development of digital services additional smaller time units might be needed.

access_unit_cost.title: Service Access Unit Cost
access_unit_cost.description: Service offered under E-RIHS can include a unit cost in Euros. This cost is expected to represent a proportion of the actual cost of providing a given Service ranging from zero to the full actual cost of providing the service. Access service costs will be based on potentially discounted actual costs and may not include any for-porfit contributions

hours_per_unit.title: Service Access Hours per Unit
hours_per_unit.description: Accesses Units are describe as time periods, but depending on the nature of a service this might relate to a range of different periods of activity time. For example a day could relate to a working day or a calendar day, a digital service could relate to run time or processing time. So this value is used to relate actual activity time to the recorded access unit..

service_active.title: Active service
service_active.description: Is the service currently open for access?
